title: Trump won't say if Russian bounties came up in Putin call
description: A reporter asked President Donald Trump whether he brought up alleged Russian bounties on US troops in a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin, but Trump falsely claimed that he doesn't discuss his calls with foreign leaders.

title: MLB team cancels home opener after coronavirus outbreak among players and staff: reports
description: The Miami Marlins' home opener against the Baltimore Orioles set for Monday has been canceled due to a number of Marlins players and staff testing positive for Covid-19, according to multiple reports.

title: US sees early signs that new coronavirus cases may have hit a plateau
description:
• Trump's national security adviser tests positive
• LIVE: White House says Trump and Pence at 'no risk of exposure'

title: A North Korean coronavirus outbreak might be the biggest threat Kim Jong Un has ever faced
Black voices speak their truth: What they wish you knew
description: Inspired by the storytellers, the conversations and the art that have arisen from the Black Lives Matter movement, we know that there are a lot more stories that need to be told, and a lot more listening that needs to be done. So we handed the mic over to Black people across the US to ask them to share their thoughts, their feelings and their experiences with us. We worked with artists and animators to bring their words to life. Here is what they wish you knew.

title: Protests erupted across the US this weekend. Here's what happened in 6 cities
description: Protests flared up across the country this weekend, two months after the police killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis catalyzed a nationwide reckoning over race and policing.

title: Republican Senator calls slavery a 'necessary evil'
description: Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas described slavery as a "necessary evil" in his ongoing effort to prevent US schools from teaching the 1619 Project, an initiative from The New York Times that reframes American history around the date of August 1619, when the first slave ship arrived on America's shores.

title: This country regrew its lost forest. Can the world learn from it?
description: Pedro Garcia nurses a plate of seeds on his lap. "This is my legacy," he says, tenderly picking up the seed of a mountain almond -- a tree which can grow up to 60 meters (200 feet) tall and is a favored nesting spot for the endangered great green macaw.

title: Lewis Hamilton clarifies anti-vaccine Instagram post after backlash
description: Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has clarified his views on a potential coronavirus vaccine after sharing an anti-vaccination post on social media.

title: 'Tenet' will open internationally before the US
description: Overseas audiences will have a chance to uncover the mysteries of "Tenet" before moviegoers in the United States.

title: 'I was too fat,' Boris Johnson says in UK launch to tackle obesity
description: Boris Johnson, the UK Prime Minister, has said in a video posted to his official Twitter account that he was "way overweight" when he was admitted to intensive care earlier this year after becoming infected with Covid-19.

title: This summer, multiple spacecraft are launching to Mars. Here's why
description: If it seems like Mars is a popular destination right now, that's for a reason: The chance to fly there only comes around every 26 months.

title: Melania Trump announces Rose Garden renovation
description: Melania Trump announced Monday she will oversee a renovation of the White House Rose Garden, overhauling the iconic greenspace adjacent to the Oval Office and West Wing.

title: The Hindu bagpipers of New Jersey
description: Shree Muktajeevan Swamibapa Pipe Band leader Tushar Patel knows that kilt-wearing Indian bagpipe players aren't something you see every day. Affiliated with the Shree Swaminarayan Temple in Secaucus, New Jersey, the bagpipe troupe was born of its spiritual leader's love for the folk instrument. Today, these self-taught musicians proudly blend Indian, Scottish and American aesthetics and influences and dedicate themselves to spreading a message of peace and unity.

title: A rescuer abseiled 130 feet down an airless well to save a trapped owl
description: Rescuers in northern Germany have managed to save a young eagle owl who was trapped at the bottom of a 130-foot well at a ruined castle.

title: Behind closed doors during one of John Roberts' most surprising years on the Supreme Court
description: Chief Justice John Roberts did not flinch.

title: US flag lowered at dawn as Chengdu consulate officially shuts in retaliation for Houston closure
description: The American flag over the US consulate in the Chinese city of Chengdu was lowered at dawn on Monday, as the diplomatic mission officially closed amid worsening relations between Beijing and Washington.

title: Paris Saint-Germain suffers big injury blow ahead of Champions League
description: Paris Saint-Germain's Champions League hopes suffered a major blow Monday as the club confirmed star forward Kylian Mbappe will be out for three weeks with an ankle injury.

title: Hubble telescope captures stunningly clear image of summertime on Saturn
description: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has beamed back an amazing photo showing summertime on Saturn.

title: The world's hopes for a coronavirus vaccine may run in these health care workers' veins
description: In the corner of a COVID-19 ward in Sao Paulo, Brazil, a woman cleaning the mouth of an intubated patient carries an extraordinary hope for pretty much all of us. Slipping a mouthwash-soaked brush into an elderly woman's mouth, at great personal daily risk, dentist Denise Abranches has something more than courage in her veins.

title: Stalled US recovery leaves Congress no margin for error
Wiley sparks Twitter virtual 'walkout' over anti-Semitic tweets
description: Actors, activists and performing arts organizations are staging a 48-hour protest over the platform's handling of anti-Semitic posts over the weekend by a popular British rapper.

title: A Red Lobster employee saves a rare blue lobster from the dinner plate
description: A rare blue lobster has received a reprieve after a restaurant sent it to an Ohio zoo for conservation instead of consumption.

title: US ambassador to South Korea shaves off his controversial mustache, saying it's too hot under a mask
description: The US ambassador to South Korea has shaved off his controversial mustache, saying it was too uncomfortable when wearing a mask as part of coronavirus measures.

title: Google will let employees work from home until at least next summer
description: Google will let employees work from home until at least July 2021, a company spokesperson said on Monday.

title: NASA will send a balloon the size of a football field to study how stars form
description: NASA plans to send an enormous balloon to the edge of Earth's stratosphere in search of secrets about how stars and planets form.

title: Protests continue over fight for racial equality in America
description: CNN's Lucy Kafanov reports on the ongoing nationwide protests over racial injustice in America, sparked by the death of George Floyd.

title: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson are officially Greek citizens
description: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson have a special reason to celebrate this week: they're both officially Greek citizens.

title: How to prepare for a hurricane during a pandemic
description: As the 2020 hurricane season continues to hit amid the already devastating Covid-19 pandemic, HLN meteorologist Bob Van Dillen shares some tips on how to stay safe.

title: No beer, no food and less chatting. The new normal for baseball fans in South Korea
description: South Korean baseball fans are back.

title: Doja Cat tested positive for coronavirus after downplaying it
description: Back in early March Doja Cat had some words for those she said were unnecessarily afraid of Covid-19.

title: Olivia de Havilland: Vintage black and white photos capture star's fashionable moments
description: Olivia de Havilland, known as one of the oldest surviving stars of Hollywood's "Golden Age," passed away on Sunday at the age of 104.

title: Peaceful protests and violent clashes erupted this weekend. Here's what happened in 6 cities
Vietnam evacuates 80,000 tourists after new Covid-19 cases
description: Vietnam is evacuating 80,000 people -- mostly local tourists -- from the popular resort city of Da Nang after three residents tested positive for coronavirus, the government said.

title: HSBC denies colluding with US to 'frame' Huawei as pressure from China mounts
description: HSBC's struggle to balance its global role with protecting its huge business in China is getting even more difficult.

title: Video shows mass graves being dug in Africa
description: Experts are warning that coronavirus infection rates in several sub-Saharan countries are alarmingly high after the region was initially spared the onslaught of cases expected. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

title: A big warning sign for Trump's campaign
A North Korean coronavirus outbreak might be the biggest threat Kim Jong Un has ever faced
description: The ruling Kim dynasty of North Korea has for decades predicated their regime on the notion that only they can protect the Korean people from the outside world, be that capitalists, the United States or other hostile forces.

title: See the streets in Chengdu after US consulate shut down
description: The US Consulate-General in the western Chinese city Chengdu has officially shut down. Beijing ordered the US to close the site days after Washington forced a Chinese consulate in Houtson to cease operations. CNN's David Culver reports.

title: Aides try to absolve Trump of responsibility
